DOCNAME: SIJAKOVA AND OTHERS v. "THE FORMER YUGOSLAV REPUBLIC OF MACEDONIA"
TEXT: The applicants , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON and PERSON , are NORP nationals who were born in DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE respectively . The second applicant lives in GPE , whereas the others live in GPE , both in the Former GPE . They are represented before the ORG by PERSON , one of the applicants , a retired lawyer from GPE .

The applicants’ children , after attaining DATE , joined the monastic order of ORG . The applicants admit that they themselves are practising NORP . They allege that some of their children left their homes and joined the monastic order without the ORG prior knowledge or consent .

In DATE the applicants lodged a complaint before ORG ( Уставен суд на ORG ) , requesting it to assess the constitutionality of the internal rules of ORG ) , in particular LAW , CARDINAL and CARDINAL . In their submissions the applicants complained , inter alia , that they had been deprived of their rights as parents to receive proper care from their children in the event of illness or in old age because the religious canons allegedly forbade contacts between monks and their parents . Furthermore , they argued that the ORG could not establish monasteries as another form of “ life community ” because the only such form recognised and protected by LAW was the “ family ” . They argued that the ORG , in claiming ownership of monasteries , which were defined as life communities in its internal rules , was thereby asserting ownership of human beings , so that their children could be regarded as being held in slavery . They further alleged that their children had been deprived of many of their fundamental human rights and freedoms as a result of the monastic canons and the vows they had taken before entering the monasteries .

On DATE ORG rejected the ORG complaint on the ground of lack of jurisdiction to review the constitutionality of the ORG ’s internal rules . In its decision , it referred to and summarised the most relevant provisions of the ORG ’s internal rules and quoted the impugned provisions .
In particular , Rule CARDINAL reads as follows :

“ The monastery is a holy place having a temple and other necessary facilities , i.e. [ it is ] a life community of persons belonging to the monastic order who have joined together in a spiritual community and have taken a holy vow to live in accordance with the monastic canons . ”
“ All the possessions of ORG , bishoprics , church communities and monasteries comprise the property of ORG . ”
Rule CARDINAL § CARDINAL reads as follows :

“ All churches , monasteries , ... - holy waters , cemeteries and places of NORP worship , and their movable and immovable assets which are under the canonical and spiritual jurisdiction of ORG are the property of ORG . ”

ORG reiterated the constitutional guarantee of freedom of religion , and the right of every individual to express his or her faith and religious beliefs freely and publicly , either alone or in community with others . It stated that this freedom entailed the freedom to hold or not to hold religious beliefs and to practise or not to practise a religion . It further held that the manner in which an individual manifested his or her religious convictions or beliefs was a matter of private conscience , which ultimately determined the relationship between religious communities and the ORG . In that connection , ORG observed that ORG and other religious communities and groups were separate from the ORG and were equal before the law , and none of them could have a distinct and privileged position or be controlled by the ORG .

ORG further held that the ORG and other religious communities or groups could not be regarded as institutional and formal associations of their adherents and that they had not been established pursuant to the provisions of the PERSON on ORG . It therefore concluded that their internal rules were not a matter for constitutional review , as was the case with political parties , other associations and foundations whose programmes and internal regulations and their compliance with the LAW might be assessed by the court .

On an unspecified date , most probably in DATE , the applicants lodged a criminal complaint ( кривична пријава ) with ORG ( Основно јавно обвинителство Струмица ) , requesting it to institute criminal proceedings against ORG , who had allegedly held their children in slavery , and had thus committed the criminal offence defined in LAW of LAW . Up to the time when the application was lodged the applicants had received no information about the outcome of the investigations by the competent authorities .

LAW ( Устав на Република Македонија ) provides that the freedom of religious confession is guaranteed . The right to express one ’s faith freely and publicly , individually or with others is guaranteed . ORG and other religious communities and groups are separate from the ORG and equal before the law . They are free to establish schools and other social and charitable institutions , by means of a procedure regulated by law .

LAW CARDINAL of the LAW provides that parents have the right and duty to provide for the nurture and education of their children . Children are responsible for the care of their old and infirm parents .

Article CARDINAL , which defines the jurisdiction of ORG provides , inter alia , that it safeguards the freedoms and rights of the individual and citizen relating to freedom of communication , conscience , thought and public expression of thought , political association and activities as well as the prohibition of discrimination among citizens on the grounds of sex , race , religion or national , social and political affiliation .
This provision also specifies that ORG decides on the constitutionality of the programmes and internal regulations of political parties and associations of citizens .

Rule CARDINAL of the Rules of Procedure of ORG суд ) provides that a person who considers that any of his rights or freedoms set forth in LAW has been violated by an individual legal act or decision may seek redress before ORG within DATE from DATE of adoption of the final individual decision or from DATE when he first learns of the action taken , but DATE from DATE of its occurrence .

Section CARDINAL of LAW ( Кривичен законик ) provides that whoever , in violation of international law , places another person in slavery or in a similar status or keeps him in such a status ; buys or sells another person or hands him over to another person ; mediates in the purchase , sale and handing over of such a person ; or induces someone else to sell his freedom or the freedom of the person he provides for or takes care of shall be punished by from one to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment .
